messages.subject: RE: [nihontostudy] Auspicious day
messages.msgSnippet: Chinese astrological considerations. The days are on rotation. Gordon ... From: David Zincavage [mailto:jdz@inr.net] Sent: Tuesday, July 01, 2003 10:52 AM To:
messages.messageBody:
Chinese astrological considerations. The days are on rotation.

Gordon
-----Original Message-----
From: David Zincavage [mailto:jdz@...]
Sent: Tuesday, July 01, 2003 10:52 AM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Auspicious day


What is it which makes particular days auspicious in the Japanese view?
Astrological considerations?

----- Original Message -----
From: Gordon Robson
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, June 30, 2003 6:46 PM
Subject: RE: [nihontostudy] Auspicious day


These days are marked on the Japanese calendar and are the most popular
for
the days weddings are held on.

Gordon
-----Original Message-----
From: Ron Hartmann [mailto:swords@...]
Sent: Tuesday, July 01, 2003 10:30 AM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [nihontostudy] Auspicious day


Hi Gordon -

This is the first time I've ever seen it written that "auspicious day"
was
what "kichijitsu" translated to. Neat...makes more sense now!
Thanks!!

Ron
STL



----- Original Message -----
From: Gordon Robson
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, June 30, 2003 6:49 PM
Subject: RE: [nihontostudy] Hizen Handbook


Hi David,

Published by JSSUS, and yes, the translation was done a long time
ago.
Kichijitsu = auspicious day as in sword signatures.

Gordon
-----Original Message-----
From: David Zincavage [mailto:jdz@...]
Sent: Tuesday, July 01, 2003 8:27 AM
To: token_kenkyu_kai@...; nihonto@...;
nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [nihontostudy] Hizen Handbook


My copy of Mr. Robson translation of Eguchi's Hizento Hikkei
arrived
today
from Mr. Watson. I find it necessary to keep a list of the titles
I
own
(senility) to keep from ordering duplicates, and when I was
entering
this
book on my list, I found no publisher, place, or date of
publication
listed.

My impression is that the JSS/US was the publisher, is that
correct?
Mr.
Robson refers to "an auspicious day" in 1997. This just appeared,
did
it
not?

What, by the way, is the Japanese for "auspicious day?"
